class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the collection of user entered data in the form of text. The default is free text but the input can be restricted to numeric characters only or to signed numbers including a decimal point.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal text input dialog with the specified message and title. Message - The dialog message. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal input dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim id As InputDialog Dim sf As Object = id.ShowAsync("", "Enter your name", "Ok", "", "Cancel", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Log(id.Input) End If

property.name: Input
property.comment: Sets the initial text when the dialog is shown and returns the text entered by the user.

property.name: PasswordMode
property.comment: Sets or returns whether this dialog hides the actual characters entered by the user.

property.name: InputType
property.comment: Sets or returns the input type accepted by the input box.Possible values are: ThisDialogName.INPUT_TYPE_NUMBERS for integer numbers. ThisDialogName.INPUT_TYPE_DECIMAL_NUMBER for signed decimal numbers. ThisDialogName.INPUT_TYPE_TEXT for free text. ThisDialogName.INPUT_TYPE_PHONE for telephone numbers.

property.name: HintColor
property.comment: Gets or sets the hint text color.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Hint
property.comment: Gets or sets the text that will appear when the dialog is empty.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.DateDialog
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the collection of user entered data in the form of a date.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal date input dialog with the specified message and title. Message - The dialog message. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal date dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim dd As DateDialog dd.DateTicks = DateTime.Now Dim sf As Object = dd.ShowAsync("", "Select day", "Yes", "", "Cancel", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Log(DateTime.Date(dd.DateTicks)) End If

method.name: SetDate
method.comment: Sets the date values of the dialog when is intially shown.

property.name: DayOfMonth
property.comment: Sets the day of month value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the day of month value of the dialog when it is closed.

property.name: Year
property.comment: Sets the year value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the year value of the dialog when it is closed.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: Month
property.comment: Sets the month value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the month value of the dialog when it is closed.

property.name: DateTicks
property.comment: Sets the date value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the date value in ticks of the dialog when it is closed.

field.name: ShowCalendar
field.comment: Gets or sets whether the calendar will be appear. Note that the calendar always appears in the material theme.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.TimeDialog
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the collection of user entered data in the form of a time. The time may be entered in 12 or 24 hour format as determined by the programmer.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal time input dialog with the specified message and title. Message - The dialog message. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal time dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Note that this dialog does not show properly in landscape orietnation. Example: Dim td As TimeDialog td.TimeTicks = DateTime.Now Dim sf As Object = td.ShowAsync("", "Select time", "Yes", "", "Cancel", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Log(DateTime.Time(td.TimeTicks)) End If

method.name: SetTime
method.comment: Sets the time values of the dialog when is intially shown.

property.name: Hour
property.comment: Sets the hour value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the hour value of the dialog when it is closed.

property.name: Is24Hours
property.comment: Sets or returns whether the dialog shows the time in 24 hour format.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Minute
property.comment: Sets the minute value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the minute value of the dialog when it is closed.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: TimeTicks
property.comment: Sets the time value of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the time value in ticks of the dialog when it is closed.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.ColorDialog
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the user to define a colour by its Red, Green and Blue components.

method.name: ARGB
method.comment: Returns an integer value representing the color built from the three components and with the specified alpha value. Alpha - A value between 0 to 255 where 0 is fully transparent and 255 is fully opaque.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal color dialog with the specified title. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal color dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim cd As ColorDialog Dim sf As Object = cd.ShowAsync("Choose Color", "Yes", "Cancel", "No", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Activity.Color = cd.RGB End If

property.name: Blue
property.comment: Sets the value of the blue component of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the blue component of the dialog when it was closed.

property.name: Red
property.comment: Sets the value of the red component of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the red component of the dialog when it was closed.

property.name: Green
property.comment: Sets the value of the green component of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the green component of the dialog when it was closed.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: RGB
property.comment: Sets the value of the red, green and blue components of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the color of the red, green and blue components of the dialog when it was closed. Alpha of the provided color is ignored on set and implicitly set to 255 (opaque) on get.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.ColorDialogHSV
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the user to define a colour by its Hue, Saturation and Value components.

method.name: ARGB
method.comment: Returns an integer value representing the color built from the three components and with the specified alpha value. Alpha - A value between 0 to 255 where 0 is fully transparent and 255 is fully opaque.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal color dialog with the specified title. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal color dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim hsv As ColorDialogHSV Dim sf As Object = hsv.ShowAsync("Choose Color", "Yes", "Cancel", "No", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Activity.Color = hsv.RGB End If

property.name: Value
property.comment: Sets the value of the value component of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the value component of the dialog when it was closed. The range of valid numbers for value is 0.0 to 1.0.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: RGB
property.comment: Sets the value of the red, green and blue components of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the color of the red, green and blue components of the dialog when it was closed. Alpha of the provided color is ignored on set and implicitly set to 255 (opaque) on get.

property.name: Saturation
property.comment: Sets the value of the saturation component of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the saturation component of the dialog when it was closed. The range of valid numbers for saturation is 0.0 to 1.0.

property.name: Hue
property.comment: Sets the value of the hue component of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the hue component of the dialog when it was closed. The range of valid numbers for hue is 0.0 to 360.0.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.ColorPickerDialog
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the user to select a colour from a palette of colours. The color may be from a standard palette in the dialog or a custom programmed palette.

method.name: ARGB
method.comment: Returns an integer value representing the color built from the chosen color and with the specified alpha value. Alpha - A value between 0 to 255 where 0 is fully transparent and 255 is fully opaque.

method.name: SetPaletteAt
method.comment: Sets the value of the color at the specified index in the current palette. This allows replacing just one or two colors without defining an entire palette.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal color picker dialog with the specified title. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ResetPalette
method.comment: Reset the palette of colors to the standard palette of the dialog.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal color dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim cp As ColorPickerDialog Dim sf As Object = cp.ShowAsync("Choose Color", "Yes", "Cancel", "No", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Activity.Color = cp.RGB End If

method.name: GetPaletteAt
method.comment: Gets the value of the color at the specified index in the current palette.

property.name: Palette
property.comment: Copies the colours in the array provided to the palette of colors in the dialog. The provided array should contain 15 colors. Returns an integer array that is a copy of the present palette.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: RGB
property.comment: Sets the value of the chosen color of the dialog when is intially shown. Returns the value of the chosen color of the dialog when it was closed.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.NumberDialog
class.comment: This configurable modal dialog allows the user to enter a number. The dialog is configurable to show any number of digits between a minimum of one and a maximum of eight. The display of a decimal point is optional and the character displayed as the decimal indicator is configurable. Note that the number accepted and returned by the dialog is an integer value and so may need scaling appropriately.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal number picker dialog with the specified title. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows a non-modal number dialog. The Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim nd As NumberDialog nd.Digits = 4 Dim sf As Object = nd.ShowAsync("Select number", "Yes", "", "Cancel", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Log(nd.Number) End If

property.name: DecimalChar
property.comment: Gets or sets the displayed decimal character in the dialog. The default is ".".

property.name: Decimal
property.comment: Gets or sets the position of a displayed decimal point in the dialog. Zero displays no decimals, one indicates a single decimal, and so on.

property.name: Number
property.comment: Sets the number initially displayed in the dialog when it is shown. If the number is negative and ShowSign is False then the absolute value is displayed Gets the number entered by the user after the dialog is closed. If ShowSign is True the sign of the number corresponds to the sign entered by the user.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Digits
property.comment: Gets or sets the number of digits displayed in the dialog when it is open. One is the minimum, nine is the maximum. The default is five. If ShowSign is True then the leftmost digit will display a "+" or "-".

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: ShowSign
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the displayed number includes a sign character. The default is False, no absolute value of the input number is displayed.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.FileDialog
class.comment: This modal dialog allows the user to choose a folder and choose or enter a filename.

method.name: Show
method.comment: Shows a modal file dialog with the specified title. Title - The dialog title. Positive - The text to show for the "positive" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: ShowAsync
method.comment: Shows an async file dialog. Dialog_Result event will be raised. Example: Dim fd As FileDialog fd.FilePath = File.DirRootExternal Dim sf As Object = fd.ShowAsync("Select file", "Yes", "Cancel", "No", Null, False) Wait For (sf) Dialog_Result(Result As Int) If Result = DialogResponse.POSITIVE Then Log("File path: " & fd.FilePath) Log("File name: " & fd.ChosenName) End If

property.name: ChosenName
property.comment: Sets the filename initially shown to the user. Returns the filename entered or chosen by the user.

property.name: ShowOnlyFolders
property.comment: Gets or sets whether to show only folders and not files in the dialog.

property.name: ScrollingBackgroundColor
property.comment: Gets or sets the background color that will be used while scrolling the list. This is an optimization done to make the scrolling smoother. Set to Colors.Transparent if the background behind the list is not solid color. The default whatever is the default for the particular device

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: FileFilter
property.comment: Gets or sets the filter values of the dialog. The filter can be a single value ".txt" The filter can also be a comma separated list of values ".jpg,.png". Note that spaces in filter values are significant and are not ignored. If a filename contains the text of a filter value the file will be displayed. A value of an empty string, the default, will show all files.

property.name: FilePath
property.comment: Sets the file path of the dialog when it is intially shown. Returns the file path of the dialog when it is closed. Note that setting the file path also sets ChosenName to an empty string.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

property.name: FastScroll
property.comment: Gets or sets whether the fast scroll thumb is displayed by the dialog.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.CustomDialog

method.name: AddView
method.comment: Adds the custom layout view, most probably a Panel, to the custom dialog. Although named AddView to match Basic4androd syntax only one view can be added. Adding a view replaces any existing view previously added to the dialog.

method.name: Show

Cancel - The text to show for the "cancel" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Negative - The text to show for the "negative" button. Pass "" if you don't want to show the button. Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

property.name: Response
property.comment: Returns the response code that the dialog returned when it last closed.

property.name: Version
property.comment: Returns the version of the library.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.CustomLayoutDialog
class.comment: A customizable dialog. Note that it is supported by Android 4+ (API 14+).

method.name: CloseDialog
method.comment: Closes the dialog and raises the Dialog_Result event. Example: DetailsDialog.CloseDialog(DialogResponse.POSITIVE)

method.name: GetButton
method.comment: Returns one of the dialogs buttons. Returns an uninitialized object if there is no such button. ButtonType - One of the DialogResponse values.

method.name: SetSize
method.comment: Sets the dialog size. If not called then the default size will be used. Must be set immediately after the ShowAsync call (before the Ready event). The actualy size of the panel will be smaller, especially the height dimension.

class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.agraham.dialogs.InputDialog.CustomDialog2
class.comment: This modal dialog displays a custom set of controls laid out on a Basic4android Panel. The Panel will be automatically centred in the displayed dialog. It is recommended to use CustomLayoutDialog instead.

Icon - A bitmap that will be drawn near the title. Pass Null if you don't want to show an icon. Returns one of the DialogResponse values.

root.comment:
This library contains several modal, that is blocking, dialogs by which the user can enter data. Presently they are an InputDialog for text, a TimeDialog for times, a DateDialog for dates, both a ColorDialog and a ColorPickerDialog for colors, a NumberDialog for numbers,a FileDialog for folders and file names and a CustomDialog.
Android does not provide modal dialogs but a special mechanism to permit this exists in Basic4android. The Android Activity lifetime system makes this support complicated because Activities can be created and destroyed at will by the OS. To avoid stack runaway on the GUI thread when an Activity is destroyed the stack must be unwound to the lowest level. The Basic4android modal mechanism does this by closing any modal dialog being shown and exiting the Sub that called the dialog, and any Sub that called that Sub and so on, in order to return the main thread to the message loop. This means that the application does not necessarily receive a return value from the dialog and has its expected flow of execution interrupted. This will probably most often happen if the device is rotated while a modal dialog is displayed so the Activity is destroyed and rebuilt with a new layout.
Because this may happen unexpectedly applications, depending upon their logical structure, may need code in the Pause and Resume Subs to deal with the fact that modal dialog closure may not always be detected. Setting a process global when a modal dialog is shown and clearing it when it returns with some checking code in the Resume Sub is one way of dealing with this possibility.
The above discussion also applies the Basic4android modal dialogs InputList, InputMultiList, Msgbox and Msgbox2.
root.author: Andrew Graham
